review: I want to like it more than I do.  It's cheap and offers access to a variety of streaming services.  It works well most of the time (occasionally have to pair it to the wifi network again, but not a big deal).  The only drawback is by design, and you have to decide how much it matters to you: there's no remote (you control it with your smartphone/tablet/PC).  I honestly thought that would be no problem for my family, but I found that all of us (even me, the tech geek) tended to avoid using it.  It somehow seems inconvenient to operate it using your smartphone as opposed to a remote control.  Especially if you've got non-technical folks in the house, this can be a problem.  My parents and 4-yr-old cannot get the hang of this.  Replaced with Roku3, which has a small (RF!) remote and it gets a lot more use.  If you don't mind not having a remote then this is a great product, but we found that having the option to use a remote is nice.
author: EquinoxV

review: This item did not live up to my expectations.  I purchased it to stream movies from my Xfiinity online account running on an iMac computer cast to an HDTV.  The product's performance was unstable and unreliable for this use.  Movies would run for a while and then stop and the WiFi link would be dropped.  I would reestablish the link and restart the movie only to have the same thing happen a short time later.  I was very disappointed with Chromecast and give a 1 star rating.  The ease and efficiency of Amazon's return process gets 5 stars, however.  Couldn't have been easier!  Thanks Amazon.
